cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 300 mi southwest of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: expected to slow, turn west, and then track northwest toward the central and upper Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central-upper Texas coast between Matagorda Bay and Freeport, near or just south of Houston/Galveston

weather_observation.under_watch: Hurricane Watch (also under Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Aransas, TX to High Island, TX (hurricane); Port Mansfield, TX to High Island, TX including Galveston Bay (storm-surge)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-west Gulf Coast from the lower Texas coast to south-west Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible at the port beginning late Sunday with a peak onset probability of 15% and cumulative 38%; a low (8%) chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2â€“4 ft of surge possible in Galveston Bay and the Houston Ship Channel.
weather_observation.rainfall: Prolonged heavy rain Sunday through mid-week with the potential for 4 inches or more and flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; large waves could hamper vessel movements and require channel closures.
